p: To assess whether feeding H. illucens larvae affects the intestinal immune function, the mRNA expression of several TLR, cytokines, and tight junction proteins were determined. As shown in Fig. 6, the H1 diet significantly down-regulated the relative mRNA expression of TLR-4 and IFN-γ compared with control diet ( P < 0.05), while up-regulated the relative mRNA expression of IL-10, ZO-1, occludin, and mucin-1 ( P < 0.05). The H2 diet also down-regulated the relative mRNA expression of IFN-γ compared with control diet ( P < 0.05), while up-regulated the relative mRNA expression ZO-1 ( P < 0.05). However, there was no significant difference in the expression of TLR-2, TLR-5, IL-8, TNF-α, and mucin-2 among the three groups ( P > 0.05).
